chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker

result.execSummary:
The defendant Norman Joseph Price was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Interfere w/ Fire Fighting-Equipment, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.12(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: This judgment is for fines, court costs and restitution that you were ordered to pay through Dept of Corrections - if not paid during probation - or you get revoked  and have not paid in full - you will be required to pay to the Clerk of Courts any unpaid amount plus interest.

Defendant Norman Joseph Price in court with attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen.  Defendant Norman Joseph Price in custody.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court:  15 CF 13: 6 months county jail consecutive with 14 CF 195 and with good time - costs converted to civil judgment

Bruce Poquette appears for the state, DEF in court in custody with Atty Lance Nelsen, Courts calls Psychologist Rebecca Seifert by phone - sworn/testifies direct; cross  - court accepts report of doctor as an exhibit;  argument; parties cannot find in statutes where court must give a 2nd opinion in this matter.  Court finds DEF competent to proceed.    DEF counsel Motion to Withdraw court takes under advisement and will decide 4-8-16 1pm

Defendant Norman Joseph Price in court with attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen.  Defendant Norman Joseph Price in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  all parties receieved report and Doctor found DEF competent to proceed, Atty Nelson is challenging the finding,  wants second evaluation and DEF wants new counsel,  court will not allow him to request new counsel when he says he is not competent.  Defendant Norman Price says in court and rejects finding of doctor and says he is not competent to proceed.  
 Court orders a second opinion for evaluation.

Defendant Norman Joseph Price in court with attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen by video from jail.  Defendant Norman Joseph Price in custody by video. Defendant Norman J. Price in court with attorney Lance M. Nelsen.  Defendant Norman J. Price in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of rights; waives preliminary hearing; ack. receipt of Information; PSI waived; Joint recommendation; parties stipulate to facts; victim notification is completed; Defendant pleads NC to Ct. 1; court finds guilty and convicts on Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 and Ct. 3 dismissed and read in.  Court asks if there is any objection to releasing competency report to probation; Defendant/Attorney do not object to that. The competency report in 13CM84 will be sent to DOC and they will be notified of the confidential nature of said report.  The report may be seen by the supervising agent or their superior but any other person must have Mr. Price's written consent. Sentence Withheld -  3 years probation; conditions of probation AODA treatment & follow-thru (05-15-15); No contact with Mike Woller, Sonja Sunderland, Joe Sajdera or their residence; absolute sobriety/no alcohol/drug use without a valid Rx; compliance with any recommended treatment; court costs totaling $518.00; 14CF195 restitution to the Sawyer Cty Sheriff Dept. in the amount of $775.00; advised of appeal rights; plea questionnaire filed. Cases DRI 15CM27 Ct. 1 & 2; 14CM141 Ct. 1 & 2; 13CM84; 14CF206;

REFUSED TO SIGN
